page.title: 12Tourism
page.content: The study area contains two buildings ofparticular interest- DEENE HALL has been developed over six centuries..from a quadrangular-plan mediaeval manor into a Tudor & Georgian mansion.The Hall faces south across gardens and a man-made lake, and has been owned by the Brudenell Family since 1514 when it was acquired by Sir Robert Brudenell.(The house and park are open to the public at weekends in the summer months) KIRBY HALL dates from 1570,and stands in a secluded hollow,and although looking habitable from the Gretton to Deene road,it is a partially restored Elizabethan house,with much of the structure derelict...but the building still presents many interesting architectural features..strongly influenced by Italian Renaissance designs.(The Hall is open daily)
